section.p: You can call this method during runtime to dynamically switch cameras based on the available ones, without restarting the video stream or reconfiguring the video source. This method is similar to switchCamera, but while switchCamera switches the camera direction (front or rear), this method switches to a specific camera by specifying the camera ID.
section.note: This method only switches the camera for the video stream captured by the primary camera, i.e., the video stream whose source is set to VIDEO_SOURCE_CAMERA_PRIMARY (0) when calling .

section.title: Timing
section.p: You must call this method after the camera is successfully enabled, i.e., after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LOCAL_VIDEO_STREAM_STATE_CAPTURING (1).

plentry.pd: The camera ID. You can obtain the camera ID using Android native APIs such as Camera.open and CameraManager.getCameraIdList.
